alert.note: Alert for Juneau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 03 at 9:01PM CDT until April 08 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Black River Near Galesville affecting La Crosse and Trempealeau Counties. Black River at Black River Falls affecting Jackson County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Yellow River at Necedah affecting Juneau County. .Recent heavy rainfall has resulted in increased snowmelt and runoff. This has led to rises on area rivers. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring but moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Yellow River at Necedah. * WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Monday the stage was 16.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM CDT Monday was 16.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.9 feet tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.6 feet on 04/23/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning.
